Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameModel

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.View.ReducedModel.RedWarehouse
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameModel.Warehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Warehouse
extends RedWarehouse
Warehouse Class defines the contents and the behaviour of the warehouse inside the player's board. Each warehouse contains three warehouseDepot-type objects organized in an array, plus two extra warehouseDepot-type objects which are activated if the player has activated the relative Leader Card ability (via the boolean attributes).
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Warehouse

      public Warehouse()
      Constructor for Warehouse Class. It creates the "pyramid" of fixed-length depots and the two extra depots. In addiction to that, it initializes the boolean attributes to "false".

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the Warehouse to its initial state.

    • activateLeaderDepot

      public void activateLeaderDepot​(ResourceType resourceType)
      Activates an extra depot and sets its resource type when a card leader ability is active.

      The first time it is called, it activates the first extra depot, while the second time it activates the second extra depot. If the method is called a third time, it just displays a message.

      Parameters:
      resourceType - is the resource type to assign to the extra depot to activate.

    • countResourcesByType

      public int countResourcesByType​(ResourceType resourceType)
      Counts all resources of a certain type inside the warehouse (including the leader-activated depots, if they are active). Specifically, the standard depots and the active extra depots are added to an ArrayList and the resources are counted in a cycle.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - specifies the type of resource searched.
      Returns:
      the number of resources counted.

    • addResources

      public int addResources​(int resourcesToAdd, ResourceType resourceType, WarehouseDepot depot)
      Adds resources of a certain type to a WarehouseDepot-type object. It returns the number of resources which don't fit inside the depot. The method checks if the depot's resource type is not equal to the specified resource type or if the depot is full, in which case it displays an error message and returns the full number of resources given.
      Parameters:
      resourcesToAdd - is the number of resources to add.
      resourceType - is the type of resources to add.
      depot - is the depot in which the resources are to be added (if possible).
      Returns:
      the number of resources which could not fit inside the depot.

    • canAddToDepot

      public boolean canAddToDepot​(ResourceType type, WarehouseDepot depot)
      Checks if a specified resource can be added to a specified depot.
      Parameters:
      type - Type of the resource to be added.
      depot - Depot where the player wants to add the resource
      Returns:
      True if the resource can be added.

    • removeResourceFromDepot

      public void removeResourceFromDepot​(WarehouseDepot depot)
      Removes a resource from a specified depot.
      Parameters:
      depot - Depot the player wants to remove resources from.

    • canSwitchDepots

      public boolean canSwitchDepots​(WarehouseDepot firstDepot, WarehouseDepot secondDepot)
      Checks if two given warehouse depots can be switched.
      Parameters:
      firstDepot - First depot to be switched.
      secondDepot - Second depot to be switched.
      Returns:
      true if the depots can be switched.

    • switchDepots

      public void switchDepots​(WarehouseDepot firstDepot, WarehouseDepot secondDepot)
      Switches resources of two depots.
      Parameters:
      firstDepot - First Depot to switch.
      secondDepot - Second Depot to switch.

      Parameters:
